repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Collection is made up of autograph books from the New York State Normal School.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Autograph books, a precursor to the modern yearbook, were utilized by many college and university students to collect notes of remembrance from fellow classmates. The New York State Normal School was no exception. The students would collect autographs from friends and classmates, leaving heartfelt notes and poems to each other. Often accompanied by these notes were small photographs of each person, or even small gifts left within the pages of the book. This practice was seemingly common at the school, until the introduction of institutional yearbooks published by the college itself around the turn of the century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The content of this collection is made up of twelve autograph books from the New York State Normal School dating from 1857-1890. Each book is made up of autographs from students at the school, often accompanied by photographs, small tokens of friendship, and heartfelt notes.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this manuscript group were donated to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The University Archives are eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Autograph Book Collection, 1857-1890. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Autograph Book Collection).

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Elizabeth Shriner Smith was born 19 August 1834, daughter of Susan Becker and Cyrus Smith, in Enfield, Tompkins County, New York. She was educated, first in common school, afterward at Ithaca Academy, and finally graduated from Albany Normal School with her twin brother, William, in 1855. She taught school several terms in the Ithaca public schools. She was married December 7, 1858 to Lyman Ostrom and they lived in Nassau, Rensselaer County, New York. They had two children-Mary, who died in 1860 in infancy, and William Lyman, born 16 June 1862.

Lyman Ostrom was born 15 January 1834 and was killed in Chain Bridge, VA., outside of Petersburg, VA on 10 May 1864 while serving in a New York Regiment. He had enlisted in the army in August of 1862 and served in Washington, DC, Folley Island, Florida, and was killed in a battle at Chester Station, VA while tearing up the railroad between Petersburg and Richmond.
